noun.description: An arrangement to meet someone at a particular time and place.
examples: she made an appointment with my receptionist

noun.description: An act of appointing; assigning a job or position to someone.

examples: the room was spartan in its appointments

phrases: This exhibition can be viewed by special arrangement with the organizers and by appointment only.
Clients can be seen by appointment outside of opening hours
Salesmen will still be able to visit private houses, but only by appointment.
Make sure to call ahead as visits are by appointment only.
origin: Middle English: from Old French apointement, from apointer (see appoint).
